summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons investigative report concerning an incident on July 23, 2019, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade noose around his neck. The report details the incident, medical findings, and subsequent interviews with Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, concluding there was insufficient evidence of an assault and no need for separation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the report; found in his cell with a homemade noose, placed on suicide watch, and interviewed about the incident.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident; interviewed and stated he discovered Epstein on the floor and reported that Epstein made uncomfortable comments about the age of consent.

connections.description: Were housed together in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York; Tartaglione reported discovering Epstein during the incident and recounted prior conversations.

events.title: Epstein found with noose in cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., staff observed Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor in a fetal position with a homemade noose around his neck. He was breathing heavily and responsive. He was restrained, medically examined, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Interview of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was interviewed by SIS staff. He claimed extreme fatigue, lack of sleep, and no memory of the event beyond hearing himself snore. He stated Tartaglione had called him a 'pedophile' days earlier but he felt safe and not suicidal.

events.title: Interview of Nicholas Tartaglione
events.description: Tartaglione was interviewed. He stated he was asleep on the floor, felt something hit his foot, and found Epstein sitting with eyes open, snoring. He reported the incident. He also recounted Epstein making him uncomfortable by stating 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states' and complaining about his attorneys.

events.title: Epstein placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An Administrative Detention Order was issued, placing Jeffrey Epstein in detention pending classification.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
Receiving and Discharge Area at MCC
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell in a fetal position with a homemade noose around his neck, resulting in neck injuries documented by medical staff.

Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, reported that during prior conversations, Epstein stated 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states and I don't understand what's the problem here,' which made Tartaglione uncomfortable.
The Bureau of Prisons investigation concluded there was insufficient evidence to support that Epstein was assaulted by Tartaglione and recommended no separation was warranted.
Epstein, during his interview, denied being suicidal, attributed the incident to extreme fatigue and lack of sleep, and stated he felt safe with his new cellmate after the incident.
The report documents that Epstein was issued an incident report for 'code 228 - Self Mutilation' following the event.
